fields.description: It would be a good feature to be able to create a project status report based on the columns created on the agile board.
fields.summary: [Request] New report based on board's columns
Agile Sprint Health Gadget avatar search links need quotes around usernames with spaces

fields.description: JIRA Agile Help and Agile Answers are showing up in the help menu even when I haven't installed Agile or asked for it at any point during the sign-up process through WAC. This is confusing for evaluators.
fields.summary: Agile Answers and JIRA Agile Help showing up in help menu even when JIRA Agile is not installed on OD instance

fields.description:
I dragged this issue to the "merged to master" column and it is resolve yet it is showing up in the QA Demo column.

!board.png!
fields.summary: Card is showing up in wrong column

fields.description:
Its still possible for JIRA Agile's upgrade tasks to create duplicated LexoRank fields, and this is causing re-indexing to fail with the following errors:
{noformat}
java.lang.RuntimeException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Expected exactly 2 rows; the maximum marker row and the lowest ranked row for rank field[id=10300]
    at com.atlassian.jira.index.FutureResult.await(FutureResult.java:35)
    at com.atlassian.jira.index.CompositeResultBuilder$CompositeResult.await(CompositeResultBuilder.java:82)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.doIndexIssuesInBatchMode(DefaultIndexManager.java:857)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.doStopTheWorldReindex(DefaultIndexManager.java:827)
    at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.reIndexAll(DefaultIndexManager.java:337)
    ...
Caused by: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Expected exactly 2 rows; the maximum marker row and the lowest ranked row for rank field[id=10300]
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerGet(Unknown Source)
    at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(Unknown Source)
    at com.atlassian.jira.index.FutureResult.await(FutureResult.java:31)
    ... 25 more
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Expected exactly 2 rows; the maximum marker row and the lowest ranked row for rank field[id=10300]
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.getMaximumMarkerRowAndPreviousRow(LexoRankDaoImpl.java:393)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.rankInitially(LexoRankOperation.java:169)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankOperation.execute(LexoRankOperation.java:111)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.lexorank.LexoRankService.performRankOperation(LexoRankService.java:239)
    ...
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer.getLexoRankValue(LexoRankIndexer.java:72)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer.getIndexValue(LexoRankIndexer.java:65)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer.addDocumentFields(LexoRankIndexer.java:51)
    at com.atlassian.greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer.addDocumentFieldsSearchable(LexoRankIndexer.java:39)
{noformat}

It is currently unknown how JIRA Agile is creating these duplicated rank fields. You can easily identify this by navigating to {{Administration >> Issues >> Custom Fields}}, check if there are multiple Rank custom fields of type Global Rank. (Not obsolete) 

When you have multiple rank fields, JIRA may be using the wrong Rank field while indexing issues. (The rank field that was not used in the balancing) So while indexing JIRA fails to find the maximum marker and minimum row.

A KB has been created describing this in detail: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Cannot+reindex+jira+due+to+Expected+exactly+2+rows+the+maximum+marker+row+and+the+lowest+ranked+row+for+rank+field
fields.summary: Duplicated LexoRank fields causes indexing in JIRA to fail

fields.description:
Our PO have been working with Pivotal Tracker but are eager to move to JIRA Agile for their scrum planning.
However, they found that one very practical feature is missing currently.
When in planning mode, JIRA agile should be able, based on previous sprints velocity, to indicate possible future sprint contents.

For example, if my velocity is 85 average on past 5 sprints, I should be able to see on planning board what my future sprints content could be by grouping backlog issues into 85-velocity sprints.
fields.summary: As a PO, I want atuomated sprint planning based on past velocity
Epic names not wrapped in the Plan mode
Issue summaries truncated/wrapped to one- or two-characters columns

fields.description:
The category color in the column is not shown for Work mode for either Scrum or Kanban board.

h4. Configuration:
!category_color_configuration.png|thumbnail!

h4. Work mode:
!category_color_board.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Column category color not shown

fields.description:
In a scrum board, the plan board has poor performance when there are many issues in the backlog (several thousand). Moving issues to epics, loading the board initially, scrolling and showing the board after creating a new issue are all very slow.

*Workaround*

Minimise the size of the backlog, either through filtering, or moving more issues to the Done column on the board.
fields.summary: Performance of plan board is poor with large backlog

fields.description:
Get the following error when navigating any of our agile boards

An error occurredHide…
Please try refreshing the page, or contact your administrator / Atlassian Support if the problem continues.
Details
Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'top' of null
Resource: https://alaskaair.atlassian.net/s/e8a391e07c35ce12136f14e1ed06c6ca-T/en_US-9h4yze/64000/15/69bf2b236c3a5dedb63388be42b93926/_/download/contextbatch/js/greenhopper-rapid-non-gadget,atl.general,gh-rapid,jira.global/batch.js?jag_disabled_marketing=true&locale=en-US
Line: 11628
Environment
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/38.0.2101.0 Safari/537.36
fields.summary: Uncaught type exception occuring on all boards

fields.description: Currently by default work query looks like: fixVersion in unreleasedVersions() OR fixVersion is EMPTY. Trivial queries could be optimized: fixVersion in unreleasedVersions(PROJECTKEY) OR fixVersion is EMPTY.
fields.summary: Optimise default work query for boards.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10970].
  {panel}

For some reason, a sprint in one board is related to another sprint in another board. For example:
# the boards may share some common issues and these issues are added to a sprint in each board (because of overlapping filter queries)
# a result of a bug as reported in GHS-10967

Owing to this, when this sprint is started/completed, the other sprint is also started/completed, and the following scenario happens:
* sprint1 in board1 contains issues A1, B2
* sprint1 in board2 contains issues C1, B2
(i) take note of the common issue B2 and assume that all these 3 issues are incomplete
* if sprint1 in board1 is completed and there's a sprint2 in this board, then:
** A1, B2 will be moved to sprint2 of board1
** for board2, as sprint1 is *indirectly* completed:
*** B2 will be moved to a new sprint2 in board2
(i) this sprint2 will always be newly created even if there's an existing sprint2 in the board
*** C1 will be moved to the backlog
* if sprint1 in board2 is completed first, the same thing happens in the other way round
fields.summary: Incomplete issues not moved to the next sprint if the original sprint is indirectly completed

fields.description:
Example: There is a filter that references a project called "Project 1". 
The project needs to be updated to "Project 2". The filter doesn't automatically update with the new name. Instead it throws an error if you are viewing the filter in the issue navigator. 

But if you are viewing an Agile board using that filter, there is no error, and no content.

The Agile board should indicate with a red banner that the project was renamed, as the issue navigator does. It may cause some confusion to the Project Administrator/Scrum Master.
fields.summary: Renaming a Project, Board filter is broken, and no error in the UI.

fields.description:
Sometimes, there will be certain unplanned or unexpected tasks that come up during a sprint. It would be great if we could set a buffer value of story points that would be saved for these unplanned issues, and we can then use it for the unplanned issues.

For example you could reserve 20 story points for unplanned tasks, if a hot fix with 5 story points is added to the current sprint, the buffer is reduced to 15 story points. So that you can plan and track better the unplanned tasks.
fields.summary: Define a buffer in story point per sprint for unplanned tasks

fields.description:
Not sure when this happened on OnDemand, but someone mentioned it this morning and when I refreshed I saw it as well. We have nine columns on our board and most devs using MacBook Pros with Chrome. Just showing the board normally there is already a bit less text shown but if one opens up the detail panel it is even worse, showing only the first three letters of the task name, in a vertical orientation.

I know we have more columns than usual, but it was workable before while now it isn't really usable with the detail panel open at all. Please see the attached screen-shot. It'd be a bit of an ordeal for us to have to change the workflow over a display issue.
fields.summary: Agile Board tasks now show less of title

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10962].
  {panel}

Problem

When attempting to configure a custom field display in JIRA Agile (v6.2.5), if you select 'ALL' then select 'Custom' again an error will appear.

Steps to reproduce

1. Open a board in JIRA Agile
2. Select a specific issue
3. Type 'E' to edit
4. Select Configure Fields
5. Select All from the drop down menu, then select Custom from the drop down menu.
6. Error is displayed *Exception: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getId' of undefined*
fields.summary: Attempting to configure a Custom Field display in JIRA Agile (v6.2.5) causes an error

fields.description:
When taking a screenshot of a jira agile board using PhantomJS, some of the widths of divs are incorrectly displayed. See the examples below.

Chrome: http://i.imgur.com/DejMKwy.png
PhantomJS: http://i.imgur.com/vjw5ddf.png
URL: https://jira.spring.io/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=5&view=detail&selectedIssue=DATACMNS-515

This could be a PhantomJS issue but if you can tell me how this width is calculated I can replicate this and create a patch for PhantomJS.
fields.summary: Agile board display issue with PhantomJS

fields.description:
It is naturally expected that if you don't have "Parallel Sprints" enabled, it should be impossible to have Multiple Active sprints showing up on the same board. However, this is not the case. There is a reproducible scenario, in which multiple active sprints will appear in a JIRA Agile board eventhough Parallel Sprints are not turned on, and this could cause some confusion for users.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Ensure Parallel Sprints are turned off on your JIRA Agile instance
* Configure two boards, one a subset of the other, but both pointing to the same project:
**  Board A's filter could be: "Project = XYZ ORDER BY Rank ASC"
** Board B's filter could be: "Project = XYZ AND issuetype = bug ORDER BY Rank ASC"
* Start a sprint on Board A, made of stories/tasks but not including any issues of bug issuetype (It is important to not include any issuetype bug to the first sprint in Board A at this point so you dont automatically start a sprint in Board B whose filter includes the bug issuetype)
* At this point Board A has one active sprint, and board B has none.
* Now start a sprint in Board B.

*Result*
* The Sprint started in Board B is also added to Board A which already has one active sprint. Causing multiple active sprints in Board A.

*Remarks*
* It is recommended that each Project have it's own JIRA Agile board, and this scenario will not come up under this configuration. However, certain customer's usecases may cause them to have different teams sharing a project, while each team has their own board (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5410 - Again, the recommended usage here is to ensure that each team's board returns a unique set of issues - otherwise you would experience this issue at some point and the results may not be desirable)
* I have not raised this as a bug, because the behavior is not necessarily incorrect (although it's confusing). The configuration of both board's filters suggests that Board A is a Parent Board for Board B, which causes sprints from the child board to show in the parent.
* Why is this confusing? Well, for most users, this result is not what they intended at all. Users of Board B for instance may be unaware that there is another board with configuration as Board A. Even if they are aware, they may not be thinking that their action of starting a sprint in their board has started a sprint on someone else's board.

*Suggestion*
 I guess this scenario can be handled better by JIRA Agile, if atleast a message at the top of Board A automatically shows up whenever this scenario has led to multiple active sprints. Explaining to all board users, how they came across the other active sprints (perhaps mentioning who started the sprint or from which board they were started). Even something as simple as the following will help:
bq. "You are currently having multiple active sprints on this board. This may be because you have other boards whose filters are a subset of this board's filter, active sprints from those other boards will automatically show up here."
fields.summary: Multiple Active Sprints showing up on one board, although Parallel Sprints have been disabled

fields.description:
I am informed by Atlassian support of the following points (see https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/ghs/problem-report-12832):

* The uninstall _intentionally_ leaves behind various pieces of the configuration - e.g. issues types.
* If the user stupidly removes these no-longer-needed pieces, he cannot reinstall the plugin unless he recreates them by hand.

This is clearly an undesirable feature and leads to the plugin not being able to handle a typical use case:

* Install Jira Agile for evaluation.
* Uninstall _completely_.
* Reinstall for re-evaluation.

I can't believe anyone consciously decided to make the uninstall this way;). The recommondation from support that one should leave the configuration after uninstallation is a poor workaround.

The fix is the following:

* Uninstall should uninstall _everything_. Or at worst offer this as an option.
* Reinstall should reinstall the plugin, even if it has been previously uninstalled.

In the meantime, there should be a big warning about this feature - see GHS-10956.
fields.summary: Jira Agile uninstall does not completely uninstall Jira Agile.

fields.description:
There were many cases where customer remove the default Agile custom fields and configurations after evaluating the plugin. However, most of our users are not aware that the custom fields, issue types, etc are not going to be re-created during the next Agile plugin installation.

Due to this, customers need to manually re-create the custom fields, issue types and configuration which is very tedious job. 

This can be avoided with the below approach:
# We should mention in the documentation / installation page that Agile plugin will not re-create the deleted custom fields, issue types or configuration data on the next installation.
# JIRA Agile should run a check if there is already an existing custom fields, issue types and configuration every installation and re-create one if there is none.
fields.summary: Documentation reminder on deleting the default Agile custom field or configuration

fields.description:
Currently, in the burndown chart, it only shows the progress of the issue from the statuses 'To Do' to 'Done'.

It would be better if the other statuses in the workflow would be shown in the chart as well, so that the users would get a better overall view of the issues in the sprint.
fields.summary: Burndown charts should show more statuses

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master, I need the ability to tie Sprints to specific "teams" to marry them together for Velocity charting, and other metrics.

Acceptance Criteria:
* During the creation of the Sprint entity, demonstrate that the sprint can be categorized with a "team" enitity (or label).
* In the board reports, demonstrate that the Velocity report has the ability to show only the sprints that share the same "team".
* On the different JIRA Dashboard "Wall Board Plugins" related to JIRA Agile, demonstrate that they can be filtered to only use sprints with a specific "team" categorization.



*More detail:*
I have multiple JIRA projects that represent different "Pillars" (i.e. different types of work).  I have Scrum teams that each have a _primary_ pillar, but that can perform work on any pillar during any sprint based on the company's goals at any given time. 

Each scrum team, while potentially working on the same application as a different team, is it's own stand-alone body, complete with DB Devs, App Devs, QA-Testers, DevOps, and Product Owners.

The problem I have is, since teams aren't isolated to Pillars, we generally have a larger unified backlog that serves the whole department, and we use quick filters to show pillar specific tasks if a team is only going to work within a specific pillar.

I have a unique sprint for each team, in order to track velocity, capacity, and success on an individual team level. This is because they estimate on within their own team.  Thus, Velocity should be unique among teams.

Unfortunately, Since each scrum board must include issues from every Pillar (i.e. Jira Project) since a team can work within any of them, the Velocity report shows ALL sprints, rather than just the ones for the Team I'm interested in.

I currently have no way to "tie sprints together".   I *could* filter each board by a ticket field, but this would mean I need to manage that field for _every_ ticket.  ANNOYING.  Thus, the Sprint label would simply this process.
fields.summary: Assign Sprints to "Teams"

fields.description: We've noticed that the most of the agile reports are by "board" or "filter", so they allow cross-project analysis, but the Release Burndown requires the selection of a specific version inside a project. Is there a specific reason? Would it be possible to align this report to the others?
fields.summary: Release burndown cross-project

fields.description:
*Case*: Issues can have labels, which is great but there isn't a way to search them in the Agile scrum view, not an easy way.

- I could create a custom filter but that's really a pain and I would have to create a filter for each possible label.

*Request*: What we really need is a way to display label in the scrum view or have a quick search by label.
fields.summary: Display Labels or Provide Search option in Agile View

fields.description:
As a scrum team member, I would like to see other members changes to the board without having to refresh the page.

Note: For scrum teams in which members are scatters in different locations, a lot of overhead will be eliminated if team members can see each other's changes on the board without asking each other to refresh the page.

A/C:
- All viewers of a board should automatically see the below items in agile board as the board content is getting updated by other users:
-- updated order of stories
-- newly created sprint
-- stories added to a sprint/backlog
-- stories removed from a sprint/backlog
-- updated title of a story
-- updated attributed of a story (priority, type, etc.)
-- updates to epics (add, remove, order, color, etc.)
- Changes should be applied no later than 2 seconds from original update
fields.summary: Real-time collaboration on Agile board

fields.description:
it`s quite uncomfortable for planin sprints while u cant add sub tasks to sprint without parent task. 
We suggest  you to think it over)) 
An to add new feature  - adding sub tasks without parent task.
Thanks in forward.
fields.summary: sub tasks in sprint.

fields.description:
Whenever I attempt to change the rank on the Agile board, I'm been getting the following error for the past 2 weeks:
JIRA Agile cannot execute the rank operation. This board has recently been configured to use the Rank field. The system must be re-indexed before you can rank issues. Ask your administrator to perform a manual re-index.

I've re-indexed multiple times but it doesn't seem to have any affect.    This is really handicapping our use of our Agile Boards.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile cannot execute the rank operation

fields.description:
Setting max limits to boards is nice. Coloring the column in red is nice. But we would like something more restrictive. We do not want to be able to drag tasks in column whose max was reached. 

We believe this will help us further improve discipline in the team.
fields.summary: As a team we would like to not be allowed to put issues in columns with maximum number exceeded

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Modfying+Multiple+('Bulk')+Issues

above article references using the Classic Planning Board, yet a bug was created in 2013, and resolved as will not fix:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-9990

if we are no longer developing the classic boards and know this creates an error, we shouldn't continue to reference this method
fields.summary: Bulk Change Documentation for Agile References Classic Planning Board

fields.description:
When an agile board is configured, by query, to display multiple active sprints, the Planning Board shows the sprints in an unknown order.  They are not sorted by start or end date, number of stories, number of points or any other metric I could figure out.  When a sprint ends and falls off of the board, the order of the remaining sprints sometimes changes - shouldn't they still sort the same relative to each other?  IMHO, the sprint ending soonest should be at top going down to the sprint ending the furthest out.  Providing a sort drop-down would be awesome.

This also causes the Sprint Health Gadget to display the wrong sprint when "Next Sprint Due" is selected as the sprint to display.  That's why I marked it a Major priority.
fields.summary: Sprints sorted randomly in Planning Board

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

If you create a new sprint, it will automatically be created on the bottom of the sprint list.

h3. Expected behaviour

We want the possibility to create these sprints on top (below the active sprint) instead.
fields.summary: As a board administrator, I would like the new sprints to be created on top

fields.description:
In our company, no normal user has "edit issue" permission.
This is needed to enable Edits screens depending on issue status and user role. For instance: In Status "In Progress " the field "Description" is only changeable for Project-Admins, but not for assignee or someone else.

Sadly some plugins need this permission to provide their full functionality.
Also JIRA Agile is only usable, if the user as the needed permissions.

The following stuff does not work without these permission:
* Create Sprints
* Drag&Drop of issue on work board
* Using field "Epic links" on screens (Setting values in the field is possible, but JIRA does not handle them.)
* ...

I would like to see JIRA Agile having their own permissions on permission scheme like:
* Create and manage Boards
* Plan issues on Boards
* Link issues to epics

Or let me define a screen, which JIRA Agile can internally use to perform needed actions.

Please find a way to make this possible, otherwise JIRA Agile is hard to use for handling Functional Safety issues (no changes after specific statuses) or following needed ISO specifications for safe SW development.

Best regards,
 Daniel
fields.summary: Using Agile without the need to have "edit issue" permission

fields.description:
Hi,

Our development methodology (based on FDD) uses Kanban and Scrum boards at same time in each project.

The "Epic" (recognized as "FeatureSet" in FDD) is the main element to group/find/structure all itens in the project scope.

So, in this way, the analists use Kanban boards (in the overall modeling phase) to discover issues (recognized as "Features" in FDD) and them use the Epics to group them.

After epics and features pass by "planning" status in the workflow... the programmers visualize them in the proper Scrum boards.

The problem is that, although the Scrum board (used by programmers)  can group  issues into the respectively epics (using the Swimlanes config), the Kaban boards (used by analysts) cannot :(

I know that we can configure Swimlanes by Queries, but it is improdutive, because (first) we use the same kaban for all projects here and (second) using this approach, we need to configure-and-reconfigure the Kanban board each time that an Epic is created/changed/deleted.

A nice feature would be Swimlanes by Epics in Kanban board, as show in attached and is currently available in Scrum boards.
fields.summary: As a Kanban Board user, I would like to group issues by epic link in Swimlanes

fields.description:
Original summary: {{Sprint duplication choice or notification when moving an issue between projects}}

h3. Current behaviour

When a ticket from Project A is linked to a sprint and is then moved from JIRA Project A to JIRA project B, the sprint is duplicated in project's B Agile board. Many users would like the sprint field to be cleared out or at least to be notified  by the system that this issue is going to occur if he proceeds with this operation.

h3. Expected behaviour

Option 1: Allow the users to configure in JIRA Agile if they want the sprint field to be cleared when the issue is moved to another project that is not filtered by the board, or if they want to keep the existing behaviour to duplicate the sprint in the new board as well.

Option 2: Keep the existing behaviour but always notify the user that the sprint is going to be duplicated, so the users are not taken by surprise when sprints appear in different boards.
fields.summary: Ability to move an issue without copying Agile sprint information

fields.description:
Currently, if the JIRA Administrator customise the screens, not to have the Epic Link and Sprint field and then perform an upgrade or uninstall/install the Agile Plug-in, these fields will be added on the screens back.

In some cases that the user has his screens precisely configured, it may generate some extra-work to the administrator adjust them back.

If it is like this by default, it should have some note in the release notes, or on the Agile official documentations, so the Administrator will be aware of this behaviour before upgrading, and will upgrade the plugin when having more time to adjust the screens.
fields.summary: Release notes should inform that Epic Name and Sprint Field will be added to screens.
dg

fields.description:
Currently the Control Charts information on time spent in a status, is most useful in retrospective of closed issues, because it doesn't show you how much time has already been spent in a status/column until the issue moves out of that status/column. Users of this chart are likely to have a faulty impression of how the project is going while tasks are still in progress.

It may probably help in-progress assessments to have a way to view real time information on how much time an issue has spent in statuses, even before the issue is moved along to the next status.
fields.summary: Real-time time spent in status data from Control Chart

fields.description:
The dropdown for selecting an epic in the Epic Burndown report sorts in the opposite direction as they appear on the Plan view; if an epic appears on the top of the Plan view, it will appear on the bottom of this report's dropdown.

(The Epic Report sorts its dropdown correctly, as a reference point.)
fields.summary: Epic Burndown report sorts epic dropdown incorrectly

fields.description:
I work with multiple agile teams and regularly look at approximately 12 jira agile boards. The current dropdown in the agile tab shows nine recent boards, but if I want to look at other boards, I need to search through all boards in the company to find the board that I need to look at. 

Being able to favorite multiple boards, in a similar way to the dashboards would make working with multiple agile teams much easier.
fields.summary: Favorite multiple agile boards

fields.description:
As a Jira Agile Enterprise user, I would like to be able to customize what fields appear on cards in the Jira Agile Kanban board work view.  Currently, I am only able to see Issue ID, a picture of the assignee, issue subject line, and dots indicating age of tickets.  I would like to be able to configure cards differently from one board to the next, and see fields such as:
1) Date Created
2) Reporter
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to customize what information appears in the cards in the Agile (Kanban) board in Work mode.

fields.description:
Currently, if the user still using the default avatar on the creation, JIRA Agile Work board will use the username Initials as the avatar.

But, if user change the avatar even though it is from JIRA itself, it will use that avatar instead in the Work View. It will be the same when the user tries to change back the avatar to the default one.

Therefore, it would be useful if there is an option in the board configuraiton whether the user would like to use the avatar or the Initials.
fields.summary: Option to use revert back to using first-letter avatar

fields.description:
SO THAT...I can see what the latest tickets ready to be worked on are

ASSUMPTIONS
* there is an auto-refresh in the work/board view, why not on the plan view
* it is creating confusion when working scrumban, as the devs do not see the latest prioritisation

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA
* given tickets are ordered in priority order, with the most important at the top
* when i move tickets about
* then other people who are logged in are able to see the latest order of tickets without having to refresh the page
* given tickets are linked to different epics
* when i move a ticket from one epic to the other
*  then other people who are logged in are able to see the latest associated epic to the ticket without having to refresh
fields.summary: As an Agile JIRA dev user, I would like the plan view to auto-refresh

fields.description:
As stated in GHS-10897 and GHS-10872, we have Jira on Demand, and we are having issues ranking issues on our boards.

We tried re-indexing many times, and we made sure I had permission to schedule issues. Nothing is working.
fields.summary: Agile cannot execute rank operation

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

If I close the issue detail view, it will stay closed if I click on a ticket within the same sprint, but clicking on one issue from a different sprint will reopen the detail view.

h3. Expected behaviour

We want the ability to enable/disable the detail view if needed.
fields.summary: As an user, I want the issue detail view to keep closed when changing sprints

fields.description:
As a product owner, I want to be able to reorder the fixversions in the version column so that I can move to the top the ones that I want to work with. 

Currently, right now, every version appears for the projects that my filter is associated with. So, I have 15-20 versions appearing and have to scroll to locate the versions that I want to focus on.
fields.summary: Reorder fixversions

fields.description:
As a product owner that manages a team that works on a variety of projects at one time, 
I want only the fixversions that are associated with the issues that I have included in my filter to display in the versions column of the scrum board
To reduce the amount of noise and scrolling required to work with the board and our team's backlog. 

Right now, we have teams that work on issues that may cross 3-5 different projects, even more.  We create a scrum board based on labels that identify the team. 

However, the board displays every unarchived version associated with every project that the filter's query is associated with.  And, it's not clear, without expanding each version, which have issues associated it. 

The versions functionality should be consistent with the epics in that only those epics that meet the filter criteria appear on the board - not every epic associated with the project that the filter is associated with.
fields.summary: Do not include fixversions that aren't relevant to the filter
One user (user name:Giedrė) of our team can't see Agile boards (doesn't open the window) while others can. All permisions are the same.

fields.description:
I want to have the chance to go to my Favorite Boards with one click. As we have many Boards, it is always time consuming to click through the whole menu to get to the most used Jira Boards. The List below "Agile" contains always the latest used ones (but these or not the most desired ones).

Proposal:
Possibility to maintain fav. Boards under Profile (feature should behave like maintaining quick filter)
Depending on that order some new buttons are show at the top menu (next to "Create" button.
If you click on one of these buttons, it goes directly into the planing site of the board.
fields.summary: Direct-Link (Buttons) for Favorite Boards in Menu

fields.description:
Currently, JIRA Agile did not check for platform compatibility during upgrade or install.

The check should at least check for database versions and also required database permission to prevent fatal problem after upgrade.
fields.summary: Check platform compatibility prior upgrade or install
Receiving an SQL error when cloning an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10904].
  {panel}

When attaching a screenshot via JIRA Agile, Ctrl + V (win) or Cmd + V (mac) does not paste image

*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Open an issue in JIRA Agile
2. Click [...] icon and select 'attach screenshot'
3. Follow directions to take a screenshot, then paste the image.
4. The image is not pasted into the indicated area on screen

note - pasting the screenshot into another application works 

*Workaround*
Paste the image after opening the issue in JIRA rather than JIRA Agile
fields.summary: When attaching a screenshot via JIRA Agile, Ctrl + V (win) or Cmd + V (mac) does not paste image

Specifically Exclude Known Milestones/Release Candidates From Mjolnir

fields.description: Currently, the only way to restrict users to create create JIRA Agile boards is by not giving the *Create Shared Objects* Global Permission to its groups. But, this will make the user unable to create both boards. Therefore, it would be useful if there is an options (might be like a role same as Service Desk) to restrict user to create a specific board. This is to prevent other team whether it is scrum or kanban to create another type of board.
fields.summary: Option to Restrict Groups/Users to Create Scrum/Kanban Board.
Harden rendering of issues in epic panel when issues don't have a rank value

fields.description:
Is it possible to turn off the Kanban board feature in JIRA? We don’t want people starting Kanban. It’s not an approved lifecycle model in our organization.

Reference: JSP-197462
fields.summary: How to disable/hide "Create Kanban Board" option.?

fields.description: The tooltip explaining how to create a sprint overlays the backlog all the time. In the phase of planning a new team, you'll see this for weeks. This really affects my client's opinion of JIRA which I've recommended.
fields.summary: "Create Sprint"-Tooltip always overlays interface

fields.description:
If a user tries to use the "Create issue in Epic" link in JIRA Agile for an Epic belonging to a project in which the user has no 'Edit Issues' permission, the issue gets created anyway but is not associated with the Epic at all. The problem with that is that the user ends up performing an unintended action (creating issue outside of intended context) because of his limited permissions.

(/) The better way may be to check the required project permissions first, and give the user a choice to go ahead and create the issue outside the epic if he lacks the edit issue permission; otherwise, simply disallow the use of this feature for a user without the required permission to complete it successfully.

(i) _I have not raised this as a bug because an error message does pop up during this operation stating that the user doesn't have edit issue permission for the epic or the newly created issue as the case may be. However, it probably still doesn't make any sense to allow creating the issue outside the epic anyway without atleast a warning dialog to the customer of the outcome of his action if he chooses to continue._
fields.summary: Create issue in Epic should check Edit Issues permission in the project before creating issue
Cannot be solved this issue
JIRA Agile cannot execute the rank operation

fields.description:
I was checking the documentation for the Agile "release burndown" report and check that there are no messages letting the customer know that it is not supported. 

Here are the links I mentioned:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+Labs
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Labs+-+Viewing+the+Release+Burndown
fields.summary: Unsupported message not displayed on Labs documentation

fields.description:
I created a sprint and added some issues into it. 
After refreshing (re-entering the sprint) some of the issues jumps back to backlog automatically.

Note1: I've checked the board filter and is ok.

Note2: Some issues form exactly the same project are not autoremoved from sprint.

I tried to see if I had an update recently:
select pe.property_key, pt.propertyvalue 
from propertyentry pe join propertytext pt ON pe.id = pt.id
where pe.entity_name = 'GreenHopper.UpgradeHistory' AND pe.entity_id = 2
order by pe.property_key;


Got: 
2014-05-15T21:19:25.747+02:00
<map>
  <entry>
    <string>buildNumber</string>
    <string>42</string>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>pluginVersion</string>
    <string>6.3.13.1</string>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>changeSet</string>
    <string>2f7da9c7d757bb92</string>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>timeTaken</string>
    <string>265</string>
  </entry>
  <entry>
    <string>ranOn</string>
    <string>2014-05-15T21:19:25.747+02:00</string>
  </entry>
</map>


I have the impression the problem appeared last week.
fields.summary: Issue jumps automatically back to backlog

Expected Result:

fields.summary: Empty sprints appearing in Sprint Report

basically I would like to have sum of estimated hours for all my tasks in one column. say for example  I have 4 columns board and each column has several issues in it. Now I would like to know how many hours of tasks are there in To-Do, In-Progress columns. The total of estimated hours should be visible on top of each column. 

can someone help me to do this. 

Thanks
Jaydip
fields.summary: How do I modify the Agile scrum / kanban card as per my required field.

fields.description:
If a filter has certain statuses excluded, for example the below, it will break the chart calculations.

{noformat}
project in ("WRM", "WP", "TOOLS") AND ( status not in ("Complete", "Closed") OR Sprint in openSprints() ) AND issuetype in standardIssueTypes() order by Rank ASC
{noformat}

The planning board will exclude issues in the right-most (eg Done) column as per [Using Plan Mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+Plan+Mode]. This means there isn't a need to exclude those issues using a filter, as their status can be dragged to 'Done'.

If they are excluded, when chart calculations such as the burndown chart are done, it will break the charts so they don't appear correctly as per the example screenshots.

I wasn't sure of the best place to put this, it should be in the core docs rather than a KB but not sure where.
fields.summary: Document the behaviour of adding certain statuses to a filter on Scrum board

fields.description: On Jira 6.1.1 with Jira Agile 6.3.11.0, we have noticed that the suggestions in the drop down show sprints from other boards (which is fine) but do so in a way which is often confusing. We will often see for example the same sprint name twice, both with Active Sprint in brackets afterwards but no indication of which board the sprint belongs to. Whilst this does not happen for every option (some do show the board) not everyone does.
fields.summary: Sprint suggestions on sprint field provides confusing options

fields.description:
Precondition:
User does not have Share Permission.

Steps to Reproduce:
- Click "Agile"/'Manage Boards"
- Click "Create New Board"
- Click "Create a Scrum board"
- Provide a name and pick a Project
- Click "Create Board"

Expected Result:
The dialog advances or reports an error leaving appropriate options to proceed.

Actual Result:
The dialog reports an error but the error message itself causes the buttons of the dialog to drop below the viewable area (step2.png). Closing the error message does not refresh/redraw (step3.png).

Workaround:
Utilize the browser's BACK function.

Note:
It would be optimal if users who do not have permissions to create boards are never given the option to do so in the first place.
fields.summary: User without Share permission renders malformed dialog when creating a new Board

fields.description:
Currently, as long as two (or more) different boards have the same project in the filter, whatever sprint involving the shared project would be shown in the other board as well.

This can cause some problems if a board creates a sprint, but the other board adds/removes issues from the sprint. For example :

* There are two boards, A and B
* Board A manages project I and II
* Board B manages projects II and III
* Board A creates a sprint involving project II. Board B can view this sprint as well (but they do not participate in it)
* Board B accidentally changes the issues within the sprint, possibly causing problems with the statistics of Board A

As you might be able to imagine, this can cause complications within the boards and the teams. As such, it would be great if there is some method to restrict who can add/remove issues from specific sprints.
fields.summary: Restrict who can add/remove issues from Sprints

Hi~

Thanks
fields.summary: How do we Customizing Agile Sprint Health Gadget?

fields.description: When viewing an Issue and editing it to add it to an Epic, I would like the list of available Epics to be restricted to the same Project the issue is in. This would make Epic selection quicker and easier.
fields.summary: As a Project Manager, I would like the Epic Link field filtered to the current issue's Project

fields.description:
As a customer, in order to be able to migrate, import or synchronize data from other systems I need to be able to change the sprint status using the REST API.

Currently the sprint API does not allow change of sprint status:
```
PUT /rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/{sprintId}
GET /rest/greenhopper/1.0/sprint/{sprintId}/edit/model
```
In fact the entire REST API of GH is messed, being hard to use and unnecessarily complex. 

GET, POST, PUT, DELETE and even the PATCH are supposed to use the same URL, but that's not happening now. 

First you need to one create that is not allowing you to specify the sprint name and to edit it after in order to add additional data. Also, you cannot edit the status. 

Can you please fix that mess and implement it properly, as in KISS?
fields.summary: Enable edit of sprint status via JIRA Agile Rest API

fields.description:
Using a Scrum Board in Agile. Each story has an assigned Story Point value. I have configured the Board to be Estimation –Story Points; Time Tracking - Remaining Estimate and Time Spent.
When viewing Report – Sprint Report, most of the stories show the Story Points value and sum up to the top for each category – Completed Issues, Issues not completed, and Issues Removed from Sprint.

The problem is several of the stories don’t display the Story Points value in this report view, although if you go into the Story JIRAs themselves, there is a value for Story Points. I cannot discern any difference between the stories that DO display pts value correctly and those that DO NOT display pts correctly.
fields.summary: Story Points not displaying in Sprint Report - so rollups are incorrect

fields.description:
As per [GHS-10472|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-10472], as a JIRA Agile User I'd like to choose whether the issues I'm creating are added to the bottom or the top of the backlog, or if it should be added above the current selected issue.

Some users may think a new issue should put it to the bottom of the backlog to prevent accidentally giving the issue a priority while others may prefer the current behavior, so giving the ability to chose which suits better for the users would be great.

*Current Behavior:* 
{quote}
* When 1 or more issues have been selected -> rank the new issue after the lowest ranked selected issue
* When no issue is selected -> rank the issue at the top of where the plan mode is currently scrolled.
* When not on plan mode, new issues are ranked to the bottom of the backlog
{quote}
fields.summary: Ability to choose where new Issues will be added in the Backlog

fields.description:
As with GHS-10746, it is irritating that while:
* Viewing a project's Work board
when I:
* Press Create Issue
then:
* The "Create Issue" dialogue box defaults to the last project I created an issue in.

In preference, the consequence should be that:
* The "Create Issue" dialogue box defaults to the project I am viewing.

Similarly for Plan and Review views.
fields.summary: Create Issue on Agile Board (Active sprints/Kanban board) should default to same project as board

fields.description:
When trying to rearrange issues in the backlog or in Work mode, an error is displayed and it is impossible to reorder issues.

Error message: "JIRA Agile cannot execute the rank operation at this time. Other users may be ranking the issues that you are trying to rank. Please try again later."

*How to verify:*
When running the following query on the Jira database:
{code}SELECT "FIELD_ID", COUNT(1), "RANK" FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" GROUP BY "FIELD_ID", "RANK" HAVING COUNT(1) > 1;{code} 1 or more lines are returned with duplicate ranks.
fields.summary: Unable to Rank issues: Error: "Other users may be ranking the issues that you are trying to rank."

fields.description: An organization has two instances of JIRA running that are linked via the Application Links functionality (one OnDemand and the other is a standalone instance).  The admin of these instances would like to manage projects on the standalone instance that originated on the OnDemand instance (and vice versa) using the existing Agile board.  For example, Project X is created on the OnDemand instance which is a public-facing instance and issues are created against it.   On the standalone instance (behind a firewall and not public facing), Project Y and Z already exist.  The admin of the standalone instance would then like to be able to create boards and manage issues in Project X on that standalone instance, so that they could manage all three Projects from one instance.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user, I would like to manage projects across linked instances of JIRA in a single JIRA Agile board

fields.description:
This issue is present in Jira On-Demand.  We are seeing an accurate burn down chart for the work done in our sprint, but when we look at the report we are seeing that most of the items represented in the burn down chart show as 'Issues Removed From Sprint'.  This has an adverse impact on our velocity chart.  Also all of these issues were closed or resolved and show the status of Ready for QA, which is also wrong.

I have attached screenshots of both.

I am reporting this as a bug, as we have not changed our processes around managing sprints, or sprint items, and I see there was a release to On-Demand in late May 2014.
fields.summary: Stories/Tickets incorrectly showing as "Issues Removed From Sprint" in Sprint Report

fields.description:
We really like the "Release..." button on the Kanban board that takes all issues in the last column on the kanban board and creates a Version as specified and then sets the fixVersion of each of those issues to that version. However, in some cases we don't want to mark that Version as "Released" but rather just update the fixVersion field - declaring that that issue will go into that new version you specify, but not necessarily saying that that version is released.
Is it possible to have a dropdown on that "Release..." box with the Version options on the Version Management page (Released, Archived, etc.)

I attached an example UI of what I'm talking about, although there are other ways this could be accomplished (such as a checkbox "Create Version and assign fixVersion field, but do not mark as released")
fields.summary: Allow "Release..." on Kanban board to have a drop for release status
How can I get the source code of JIRA Agile (I do have a commercial license)

fields.description:
To help manage a large backlog and select relevant issues to go into a sprint I want to be able to quickly and dynamically filter the view of cards on the planning board by clicking on the name of any of the available Components in my project.

The way the Classic Boards does this is excellent. You have transposed and provided this quick filter functionality for Versions and Epics with the left-hand filter panels, so it would be appreciated it the same could be done for Components.

An alternative, (albeit less user-friendly) would be to provide a JQL box alongside the quick filters which allows dynamic filters to be crated on the fly (component = "Widget-33").

The same filtering ability would also be useful in Work mode as well as Plan mode.

Once this is in place we have no more barriers to using the new rapid boards and can move off the (still excellent) Classic Boards.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user I would like to filter the cards displayed in the Backlog by component so that I have at least as much functionality as I have on the Classic Boards

fields.description:
Now that the StatusCategory property exists, it would be much easier to work with Epics if the behavior around the "Epic Status" field could be deprecated in favor of the StatusCategory property.

A PO would set-up a Kanban board to work with (and eventually plan - see GHS-6175) Epic-level items and this would be reflected in the Scrum boards automatically.
fields.summary: As a PO, I want the Epic status field to match the StatusCategory of the Epic so that I can work with a Kanban board

fields.description:
We have a custom workflow and a custom Work board with 8 columns.

We would like the entire Issue title to be displayed on the cards (which would result in a vertical browser scroll bar) on the board as currently only a few words (dependent on browser window width) are shown and we need to hover over the card to display the full title in a tool tip.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to configure the Agile Work Board layout

fields.description:
When viewing the worklogs in the right side-pane of JIRA Agile, the logs do not appear until the worklogs for either "My Worklogs" or "All Worklogs" has been clicked. See images below for details.
!agile_panel.png!

!agile_panel_after_clicking_AllWorklogs.png!
fields.summary: Worklog entries are not displayed on Agile side-pane unless "My worklogs" or "All work logs" buttons are pressed

fields.description:
Steps to repro:
1. Go to Agile getting started page
2. Create a new Scrum board (new project & board -> any names, project key=AAAA -> Agile simplified workflow=checked)
3. Delete board and project
4. Go back to agile getting started page
5. Create a new Kanbam board (new project & board -> any names, project key=AAAA -> Agile simplified workflow=checked)

Expected:
- Project & Board workflows to contain the Kanban simplified workflow states (backlog, selected for dev, in progress, done)

Actual:
- Project contains the Scrum workflow (todo, in progress, done)
- Board contains the Kanban workflow (backlog, selected for dev, in progress, done)
fields.summary: Re-using an old project code when creating a new board/project results in incompatible workflows

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10819].
  {panel}

JAG uses JIRA's property sets to store configurations. We frequently access these property sets in various services (ex. SprintCustomFieldServiceImpl). 

However we don't cache these property sets, thus resulting in a lot of unnecessary  db access to retrieve the data for the sets each time we want to read a property.

We should apply an appropriate caching strategy for these property sets.

This has appeared to cause significant bottlenecking in a customer instance, where almost every JIRA Agile thread is blocked on a thread waiting on a response from the database due. Screenshot of threads attached.
fields.summary: Cache frequently used PropertySets
Transition names displayed instead of available statuses when dragging Issues between columns

fields.description: I want to be able to collapse my columns in a case where i have many columns (>= 4), as i can collapse my swimlanes. (see screenshot)
fields.summary: As a Agile Board user, i want to collapse columns like i can on swimlanes.
